aboutMe.title: About me
aboutMe.text:
Hello, my name is Alexander and here is some information about me. I'm 33 years old and over 3 years ago I made the decision to dive into the world of programming, specifically front-end development. After completing my education at GoIT IT school, I gained a solid knowledge foundation.

 In both work and life, I always uphold personal qualities like responsibility, perseverance, and punctuality. I genuinely enjoy the world of programming and crafting unique web applications.

 Currently, I'm in the process of seeking new career opportunities and am open to considering job offers. If you're interested in my portfolio or would like to get in touch with me, you'll find my contact information below or can visit the 'Contacts' page. My goal is to continue growing in the field of front-end development and contribute my skills to exciting projects that make a positive impact.

html.title: HTML
html.text: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is a standard markup language used to create web pages and structure their content. HTML allows you to define elements and their relationships on a web page.

css.title: CSS
css.text: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is a style language for web pages that defines the visual appearance and formatting of HTML elements, including colors, fonts, sizes, and layouts, to create stylish and consistent websites.

sass.title: SASS
sass.text: SCSS is a CSS preprocessor that extends standard CSS with advanced features, streamlining style management for web applications by introducing variables, nested rules, mixins and more.

js.title: JavaScript
js.text: JS (JavaScript) is a high-level programming language used for creating interactive web pages and web applications. It enables dynamic behavior on websites and allows users to interact with web pages.

react.title: React.js/React Native
react.text: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces that simplifies the creation of interactive and efficient web applications. It is component-based, making code organized and easy to maintain.

redux.title: Redux
redux.text: Redux is a state management library for JavaScript applications that simplifies data and state management by providing a centralized store. It enables predictable data handling and enforces a unidirectional data flow in the application.

webpack.title: Webpack
webpack.text: Webpack is a powerful JavaScript build tool used for bundling and optimizing resources in web applications, facilitating modular development and efficient asset management.
